website_summaries.verdict: An okay keyboard for the price, but its stiff key action combined with short lifespan make this a no-go.
pros: Hefty build, a heavier keyboard than many are used to
cons: Key caps are too small, causing misses and slips
Doesn’t remember lighting settings, requiring reprogramming on each use
Short lifespan, with keyboard often failing after a year or less

customer_reviews.title: Cant imagine my life without this keyboard
customer_reviews.text: I am not a gamer. I was looking for a keyboard specifically for the office. I am a programmer and type a lot on the daily. My criteria for a keyboard was : 1) Is mechanical 2) Cannot be too loud as to disturb my nearby cubicle neighbors 3) Feels good to type on I am happy to report that this keyboard meets and exceeds all of my criteria. The brown switches really arent loud but feel much better than a regular membrane keyboard to type on. The backlight is a nice feature thrown in there but I hardly use it at work.
customer_reviews.author: Sophia

customer_reviews.title: Had it for about 6 weeks now it's unusable
customer_reviews.text: I've had the keyboard for about 6 weeks. Once before I didn't plug the keyboard in to charge overnight and when I came in the keyboard was dead. Even when hooked up through the USB to the desktop the keyboard was unusable. After it got a sufficient charge the keyboard came back to life and I was fine to use it. Well this morning I came into my office and the keyboard was dead (despite having been plugged in) and its been charging for the last 2 hours and it's still unusable. Very Disappointed but what can you expect when you spend less than $60 bucks on a mechanical keyboard.
customer_reviews.author: Matt G

customer_reviews.title: BUYER BEWARE: Very, VERY poor quality keyboard.
customer_reviews.text: Where to start? The battery life is very poor and gives no indication when it's winding down. You'll just be typing and then - oh, it's dead. Completely dead. It's functionally not wireless, and what's worse - even though I'd leave it plugged in overnight to charge, in the morning the battery would be just as dead as when I left it. Unbelievably inconsistent charging. The equally fatal flaw is that within two weeks of use, the keyboard began emitting a high-pitched tone at all times. If you want to know what it's like to have tinnitus, get this keyboard. Please, please, please: don't buy this keyboard. Velocifire does not deserve your money.
customer_reviews.author: NEVER purchase from Hearthshire

customer_reviews.title: Great Value Purchase Especially If You Want A Budget Mechanical Keyboard.
customer_reviews.text: First off... This keyboard was $38. It has inexpensive (read: not MX Cherry brand) brown switches, but it was only $38. It works well for both gaming and doing work, and it was only $38. It has a teal colored backlight, and it was only $38. The letters on the keys is not all that great, but it was only $38. THIS KEYBOARD WAS ONLY $38. It is a real value buy, especially if you need just a basic budget 10 key keyboard for work or school, but you want a mechanical keyboard. I really can't tell the difference between these inexpensive brown switches and MX Cherry Brown switches.
customer_reviews.author: Cody Lee

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy its not worth it
customer_reviews.text: I hardly used this keyboard and it completely died 2 months after I bought it. I charged it 3 times in the 2 months I had it. After the 3rd charge it just died. It won't even work with the cable plugged in. DON'T BUY... UNLESS YOU LIKE BUYING EXPENSIVE TRASH. It will die as soon as the return window is gone. I bought it on July 15th and it died on September 20th. Now I am stuck with a nice looking piece of garbage.
customer_reviews.author: Hassan Almaweri

customer_reviews.title: Great keyboard until a lack of durability shows
customer_reviews.text: I used this keyboard at work where I work in analytics/coding. I really loved this keyboard for the first year. At this point (about 18 months) I have 3 keys that are failing and will need to replace the keyboard shortly. Those keys are backspace, left shift, and left ctrl. At first I thought it was just that I didn't depress the key far enough, but as the keys continue to degrade further I realize that the failure is mechanical (backspace requires significant effort on the left side to register at all now). Not sure if I will replace with the same, as it was a great value.
customer_reviews.author: Paul C. Grommesh

customer_reviews.title: Decent keyboard for the price
customer_reviews.text: This is my first mechanical keyboard, so this review is from the perspective of a casual consumer who does a lot of typing for my job as a software developer. Pros: -Great price -Decent feel when typing -Lighting effects are cool -Nice weight and overall build quality Cons: -Keycaps are very slick and cheap feeling -Font is not very readable -Not a fan of the ergonomics/layout/key depth Overall, a good keyboard for the price and a nice introduction to mechanical boards.
customer_reviews.author: RetroDad

customer_reviews.title: Great intro keyboard, but not all the keys produce the same sound.
customer_reviews.text: What a great USB wireless mechanical keyboard. A simple, clean aesthetic with backlighting and a USB C charging port is great! Unfortunately, that crisp clean sound and feel you expect from a mechanical keyboard switch is present on all of the letter and number keys; yet, larger/wider keys such as the enter key, shift, backspace, tab, etc, produce a lasting "spring" like noise compared to the rest of the keyboard and numpad. While a minor imperfection, it is definitely a noticeable and irritating issue, especially when you are typing long documents or lines of code and constantly hitting the enter key.
customer_reviews.author: Patricia

customer_reviews.title: Love this keyboard
customer_reviews.text: I like the keys that are raised and separate and the backlight is really nice. I work from home and am a 72-year-old female so not the greatest in the tech department. I very much dislike those flat keys on most of the new equipment. It took me a little while to get used to it, but I am totally hooked. I type faster, and my accuracy is getting better all the time. I highly recommend this keyboard to anyone who is like me. My husband says this is a gamer's keyboard, and I can really see why. The touch is so light and fast.
customer_reviews.author: Smileyface

customer_reviews.title: Bad for mac - does not wake up
customer_reviews.text: There was one major problem with this keyboard, when my mac woke up, the keyboard did not, about 50% of the time it would have to be physically unplugged and replugged in to return to normal operation. I've used a lot of keyboards with my mac and this is the only one that has ever shown this behavior. Perhaps the unit I had was defective, but otherwise it performed very nicely. Had same annoying behavior on macbook and imac. I can only assume it doesn't do this on pc's because nobody would buy them if it did.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Loud as hell, very heavy key press, good value
customer_reviews.text: I have some blue and red switch mechanical keyboards and neither is as loud as this beast. HELLA LOUD. Also, on the far end of the scale for effort on key presses. First time I've ever had a keyboard that actually wore me out on lengthy typing sessions. Backlighting is good with adjustable settings. Weighs a lot, not going to slide. Overall, get what you pay for which is average to good quality at a low, low price.
customer_reviews.author: CaptainSnide

customer_reviews.title: Works Great! Just a Couple Minor Annoyances...
customer_reviews.text: This keyboard is great for what I needed... Which was a decent, cheap, mechanical gaming keyboard. Overall, I'd say it's pretty great, but after a while I noticed a few things that I don't like. The lettering/numbering on some of the keys is not really legible. It's kind of like the font "Impact". But I'd wager whoever developed THIS typeface never took graphic design... Also there's no Print Screen button. I didn't notice that initially, and since I'm new to PC gaming, I'm also probably missing some other keys that I don't even realize yet. So, just look carefully at the images before you buy, so you know what you're getting & not getting.
customer_reviews.author: Sara M

customer_reviews.title: I would love this keyboard, but...
customer_reviews.text: I like everything about this keyboard, except for one little thing - it has SERIOUS driver issues with Windows 10. Win10 constantly drops the driver after every update, and the keyboard stops working after every reboot. Windows really hates this keyboard. I've spent hours reinstalling drivers, removing drivers, plugging and unplugging this keyboard into different ports, etc. It is a serious pain in the behind. If you are windows savvy, or never turn off your system, this may not be a huge issue, but if you aren't - beware - you will be seriously disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Batmanintexas

customer_reviews.title: Too many repeat characters
customer_reviews.text: it feels nice but too many times I will get doubles of a letter I type. This doesn't happenn (<- There is one now) on any of my other keyboards. n and r are the worst ones but I have had doubles of arrow keys as well making it difficult to use. I have resorted to hitting keys far harder to mitigate the problem but as you can see above it still happens. Honestly buy a different brand, I dont care how nice the case is, repeat keys makes even a $1000 keyboard worthless.
customer_reviews.author: Timothy D. Gray

customer_reviews.title: Great no frills keyboard
customer_reviews.text: I wanted a wireless keyboard that had a great feel and response without a lot of bells and whistles. I'm not a gamer but do a lot of typing with the keyboard on my desk and in my lap. This keyboard gets high marks for everything that I consider important and is a huge improvement over a "standard" wireless board. I wish the instructions were a little more comprehensive, but customer service was excellent when I didn't understand how to get the wireless function working (this one has an on/off switch which my previous one didn't). Overall an excellent keyboard, especially at this price point.
customer_reviews.author: MvH

customer_reviews.title: updated review - unresponsive keys
customer_reviews.text: It took me a bit of time to get used to the keyboard, but once I did it has become my favorite. The only flaws are the pointy edges which become problematic for me as I move the keyboard frequently, but if others don't move theirs I don't see it as an issue. update - Like a few others who have reviewed I now have unresponsive keys after 3 months use(would use a comma here but it doesn't work) also the rubber pads fall off easily. May want to pass on this and buy a better quality product.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew

customer_reviews.title: Bad for Gaming
customer_reviews.text: No battery level indicator. As the battery level gets low, it will not read the occasional key stroke until it stops responding entirely. Even at full power however, the keys don't always recognize key presses. I suppose I just need stronger fingers, or maybe it's just a mechanical keyboard thing.
customer_reviews.author: Al

customer_reviews.title: Holding up in an abusive enviroment.
customer_reviews.text: Eight months in a call center environment and still going strong. Our lease ran out on the old PC's and the new desktop PC I received had what I could best describe as a nearly flat, laptop keyboard. It was very difficult to type on. Aggravating at best. So I went looking for another keyboard. I visited a few electronics stores and found most new keyboards to be unsatisfactory except for the gaming keyboards. But there was no way I was going to pay the price for one. Luckily I stumbled across the Velocifire on Amazon. Love it.
customer_reviews.author: B. Boyd

customer_reviews.title: Great Office Keyboard
customer_reviews.text: I work in an open office, and as such, have to cohabitate with others. I had another mechanical keyboard, and people were whining that I typed "too loud." I moved over to this keyboard, and the problem disappeared. It feels good, and is suitable for a crowded office. I have a much more clicky keyboard at home, but for the office, this is a good solution. The keys are solid, and quiet, and pleasing to type on.
customer_reviews.author: Robb Nunya

customer_reviews.title: Amazing Keyboard but...
customer_reviews.text: When I first received the keyboard, I was well surprised by the quality and weight of the keyboard. The button presses were as expected and felt similar to the MX Brown switches as advertised. For the first few minutes, everything seemed perfect until I tried to use the Windows Key. The Windows key doesn't work for some reason and it is not my computer's fault since my previous keyboard worked and using the Ctrl+Esc shortcut/replacement for the Windows key is perfectly fine. I am disappointed that there was already an issue with the unit I received. Except for this one error, I would have given the keyboard a five star rating.
customer_reviews.author: Lance Trieu

customer_reviews.title: New Roadboard
customer_reviews.text: Nice heft. Solid construction. Got two mechanical keyboards for a tad bit of variety on the road this winter: this Velocifire VM01 and an. Both excellent boards and got fantastic Lightning Deals on both, but, to facilitate my writing, I replaced the keycaps on each with. Highly recommend all three products.
customer_reviews.author: docster

customer_reviews.title: Has issues
customer_reviews.text: Absolute garbage keyboard. This thing would cause my PC to hang when booting, or it would hang the entire USB system about 1 in 3 times. Finally got to the point I couldn't get my system to boot, and have the keyboard/mouse working at all. It's going into the trash. It claims Linux compatibility, and it did work most of the time, but it either caused the computer to not recognize the boot disk, or the keyboard wouldn't be recognized at all. Even after unplugging. Windows didn't seem to have any issues, but I don't often boot into Windows. I really liked this keyboard otherwise, but with all the issues it caused, it was completely unacceptable.
customer_reviews.author: Tyler M

customer_reviews.title: Solid keyboard overall. No battery indicator
customer_reviews.text: I’m not some keyboard fanatic or anything but this keyboard does everything I could reasonably ask for. It’s heavy and has feet on the bottom so it doesn’t move around at all and it works in wired mode if you don’t feel like using the wireless functionality. Battery lasts pretty long too but there’s no warning when it’s low so it can go out unexpectedly. I use the USB C cable for my wireless charger so if it does go out at a bad time I can plug it in quickly. I like the simple look too, the brand is on the front edge of the keyboard where you won’t ever really see it.
customer_reviews.author: Rich

customer_reviews.title: Velocifire VM01 Mechanical keyboard
customer_reviews.text: I really wanted a new mechanical keyboard. So I started to read reviews of sub $100 mechanical keyboards. I finally decided on the VM01. Mine has retractable feet to raise the keyboard. This might be a new feature based on other comments. Pros Nice to type on - brown switches Retractable feet - older models don't have this Great for gaming - plays just as good as my old membrane KB Nice LED lighting Can control sound with function keys Professional look and feel Cons None
customer_reviews.author: Edward Z

customer_reviews.title: Good keyboard but durability concerns
customer_reviews.text: I would have given this keyboard a 5 star review because it was great for about 3 months. Got this in December and by March, the W stopped working properly. As gamers know, the W, A, S, D keys are among the most used and most important. The W key is the one used for moving forward in games. I contacted the company, I showed a video of actual game play of where my character stopped due to the W key and they replaced the keyboard. It's a really good keyboard but I think it has durability issues. I like it, I just hope it lasts.
customer_reviews.author: KevinGT

customer_reviews.title: Very satisfied with this keyboard
customer_reviews.text: I have been using this keyboard at work 5 days a week for several months now. It's comfortable to type on, not super loud but loud enough to give the feedback you would expect from a mechanical keyboard. The backlight is not super bright as to be an eye-sore. A couple co-workers liked it enough to consider purchasing one for themselves. I REALLY like the fact that you can lock all the keys so the keyboard can be cleaned easily without having to be unplugged. The only issue I have is that the font used on the keys is kind of strange. The font is similar to a stencil font.
customer_reviews.author: Brandon

customer_reviews.title: ... to use my collaborative work place and it is nice and quiet compared to my Green MX keyboard at ...
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this to use my collaborative work place and it is nice and quiet compared to my Green MX keyboard at home or people around me at work mashing on normal membrane keyboards. The back lighting doesn't attract attention in the office space as it is very subtle if I forget to turn it off. The keystroke does have a "scratchy" feeling that is discussed in the youtuber reviews if you slowly press a key down and examine every millimeter travel however when you actually use they keyboard to type the switches feel nice and linear, and the bottom out is satisfying. Very happy for the price and would recommend if you want a cheap, quiet mech for work.
customer_reviews.author: Timothy Howard

customer_reviews.title: Phenomenal keyboard if you can put up with the noise!
customer_reviews.text: I was tired of really crappy wireless keyboards. These new low profile and the “chiclet” keyboards are designed by people who have never typed before, I swear. Enter in the mechanical keyboard. This thing is amazing. Typing is enjoyable. The action response is fantastic. The only downside is the noise. It’s noisy for sure. You can’t type while on a conference call - everyone will hear you. Your cube mates will hate you. But if you can get past the noise, this is a phenomenal keyboard.
customer_reviews.author: Brett A

customer_reviews.title: Upside Down Caps Lock but no big deal
customer_reviews.text: great for the price. feels kinda more like an IBM keyboard from the 90’s, doesn’t completely have the same switch feel as Cherry’s, but still not bad. The only thing weird about this keyboard is the arrow for cap lock is upside down, but nothing a change of key caps can’t fix!
customer_reviews.author: Tek Vi

customer_reviews.title: Don't think this can be beat for the price.
customer_reviews.text: Don't think this can be beat for the price. Keys feel really great. Quieter and slightly softer feel than my CM Quickfire TK that also has cherry mx brown switches. Not bad, just is. As expected, huge improvement over the Dell membrane keyboard I had been using at work. If I had a complaint, it's that this doesn't have any USB input ports on it. I was actually using one of the ports on my previous keyboard, so by not considering that I'm having to temporarily reconfigure a couple things. Looking at a USB hub now. I hold none of this against the keyboard, just an observation. Perfect for a no frills, office alternative.
customer_reviews.author: Eric

customer_reviews.title: Quality at an Affordable Price
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for a mechanical keyboard with a balance between quality and price. What I found in the Velocifire VM01 is a keyboard with backlights that do not hurt my eyes when used for long periods of time and switches which outperform the other two keyboards I've been using. The overall feel of this keyboard is equal to a more expensive one. The weight is nice as is the angle. The short responsive key strokes allows for accurate typing and swift performance in gaming. Don't waste your money on more expensive models unless you really need your keyboard to have the useless rainbow effects. This one gets the job done at an incredible value. 5 Stars!
customer_reviews.author: DANIELLYNN WHITTACRE

customer_reviews.title: Good keyboard for the money.
customer_reviews.text: This keyboard is a nice mechanical keyboard for the money. I personally like the clickyness of it and effort required to press the keys. I don't want to barely touch the keys and have it register a press. After 9 months, the A key is having issues registering without a firm press but they are replacing it under warranty. But for a mechanical keyboard with backlit keys for $45, a great value. Not everyone wants super flashy RGB or anything. It's a keyboard.
customer_reviews.author: Person from Over the Rainbow

customer_reviews.title: GREAT keyboard, I am repurchasing because I love it!
customer_reviews.text: I love this keyboard! This is actually the second one I purchased because I stupidly spilled soda STRAIGHT into it, but I would happily replace it 3x over because I love it more than the $100 mechanical keyboard I purchased before. It is mechanical so it's not a SILENT keyboard, but I feel it is relatively very quiet and doesn't bother me at all, and I hate the clicking of normal mechanical keyboards. I owned my last one for over a year and it never looked or worked less than brand new, I am very happy with this company!
customer_reviews.author: Jessica Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Nice feel and build for cheap, but annoying ringing sound
customer_reviews.text: Pros: Nice mechanical key feel, similar to Cherry MX Browns. Sturdy construction. Backlight is adequate. Inexpensive. Works on Windows and Linux. Cons: Keyboard is loud, even for mechanical - there's an annoying "ringing" sound when you type that I haven't had on other keyboards (compared to a CM Masterkeys Brown). Also, takes a long time to become responsive after wake from standby on my Windows 7 system (compared to generic USB keyboard); not sure if this is a bug in my USB drivers or the keyboard. Keycap labels are a little fuzzy and stencil-looking.
customer_reviews.author: NeD

customer_reviews.title: Great value - Will not disappoint
customer_reviews.text: I like this keyboard better than my more expensive $100 Corsair keyboard. * This keyboard is easy to install * Has no confusing drivers to worry about or maintain * Great feedback, feels nice to type on it * Really cheap I am almost tempted to buy another one One con I can think about is that you cannot turn off the backlight, this would be nice for me since I use it in my office.
customer_reviews.author: Neil

customer_reviews.title: Works well, unpretentious appearence, quiet for a mechanical
customer_reviews.text: I bought this keyboard over 2 years ago and its worked great for me. Brown switches-so it isn't overly clicky, but still a bit of "mechanical" sound to it. 2 of the key stems have split over the years, but they were very easy to fix with a drop of super glue. The backlight color is not customizable. It isn't extremely over the top like some other mechanical boards can be. You could put this on a desk in an office environment and it wouldn't look too out of place. I have done some light gaming with it and encountered no problems. It is very nice for what it is, I have been extremely pleased with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Z G

customer_reviews.title: much quieter then my blue knock offs and works well ...
customer_reviews.text: much quieter then my blue knock offs and works well in the office. Middle row of LED's went out after a day. Key caps were a bit over-sprayed and some of the characters have almost a warn out look to them. [Update 7/2/2018] Was contacted by Velocifire US who was willing to refund me for the product, indicating that there failure rate was less then 1%. I must have just been in that category. Would buy from them again. Keys themselves work great, and no noise complaints from coworkers (compared to my blues, which got me a few complaints)
customer_reviews.author: L. Liukonen

customer_reviews.title: Great (re-)intro to mechanical keyboards, very pleased
customer_reviews.text: Disclaimer: I haven't consistently used a clicky keyboard since like 1989. That said, this thing is exactly what I wanted. It even has fold-out feet! Online reviews had led me to believe otherwise. The LED color and intensity suit me just fine, key movement is consistent and just loud enough to differentiate it from a membrane board, shipping was quick, and it's built so heavy that I could probably inflict some damage if someone tried to break into my home office. I'm glad my OEM Dell keyboard flaked out; otherwise I never would've rediscovered how rad these things are.
customer_reviews.author: A. Watson

customer_reviews.title: Great, but doesn't work in pre-startup on Windows (BIOs config, etc.)
customer_reviews.text: Pros and Cons: Pros: It feels great. It looks okay (too teenager for me) The light effect has different settings (throbbing, flashing, etc.) It seems pretty solidly constructed Cons: It doesn't have a USB port for flash drives, etc. It could use a longer cable Most importantly: It doesn't seem to work for me until windows loads. I tried using it to enter BIOS setup, but it would not work. I had to use my old Lenovo keyboard for that. Otherwise, it works just fine. Summary: It's a lovely keyboard, but keep another one handy in case you need to do a special startup.
customer_reviews.author: Smoke

customer_reviews.title: not wireless
customer_reviews.text: i bought this because it is stated to be wireless and is mechanical and got good reviews. it arrived with a usb cable. it turns out the cable is to charge it but upon rereading the amazon description a charger could be used. no reference to an acceptable is given. such a reference would have had me buy a cheaper mechanical keyboard. being mechanical is more important to me than being wireless.
customer_reviews.author: iginfect

customer_reviews.title: Wrong Keycaps and keys keep poping off.
customer_reviews.text: Keyboard feels great; good quality. Two of the keycaps are incorrect (see image, the second O and P), but it was about 2 weeks before I even noticed it. EDIT: The Del and End Keycaps keep poping off. Going to have to replace keyboard. EDIT: Ended up 3d printing keycaps. So far so good. EDIT: Nope, I hate this keyboard. I started off liking it but now, I'm just going to throw it in the trash. Never going to buy fake Cherry MX ever again.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Smith

customer_reviews.title: Way better than you think
customer_reviews.text: This keyboard is easily my favorite keyboard I've ever owned because it freed me. Once I started using this keyboard I stopped caring about the clicky keys on my Razer Black widow and instead enjoyed a quiet but tactile key press. The lighting modes are a bit cheesy and the light is a little dim but I like the lighter blue color. The LEDs aren't that piercing blue color that you can see through your eyelids so it's less disturbing for people who leave their PCs on all the time. The compact size is also nice if you have limited desk space. Overall a great keyboard that's sold for half of its worth.
customer_reviews.author: Edward Simmons

customer_reviews.title: Solid Keyboard
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to replace an old style Lenovo non-mechanical keyboard I have had for years. The keys were getting very spongy and not working properly. But it had a solid, heavy feel to it that I liked. The new keyboard has a similar feel if not a little heavier. It is a little taller than the old keyboard which will take a little to get used to, but not a big deal. I like the ease with which I can turn on and off the LED backlighting and the key pressure is just about right. This is my first new mechanical keyboard in many years so I look forward to putting it through its paces. First impressions are good!
customer_reviews.author: G Stooksberry

customer_reviews.title: Didn't Impress Me
customer_reviews.text: This is advertised as a half way quiet keyboard - wrong! My co-workers could hear this keyboard noise 2 cubes away. It is also somewhat uncomfortable to type, the keys are not as I expected; I can't quite find the words to adequately describe it. The function keys at the top had faded paint (or whatever they use) and so it was hard to read them. I ended up returning the keyboard. Overall, some might like/love it, but it didn't do a thing for me!
customer_reviews.author: Miss Birdie

customer_reviews.title: Nice Keyboard!
customer_reviews.text: This is not a super expensive mechanical keyboard, and I have only used it for a few weeks. But so far so good! It has a super nice feel and is not too loud. Very good for an office style environment. I had been using a Logitech Wave keyboard before, and I do not miss it at all. I will consider buying another one of these. I want to see how it holds up over a longer period of time; it does seem very well constructed.
customer_reviews.author: Dwain M. Sims

customer_reviews.title: Works pretty well but no warning before battery is dead.
customer_reviews.text: I can get 3-4 8-hour work days out of it before it needs a charge. (I turn it off at the end of every day) The only issue I have with it is that it doesn't give you a low battery warning. It just stops. Not a huge deal as I just pull out the charge cord and it's ready to go as soon as you plug it in. But a little bit of a warning would be nice. Overall pretty happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: Shane Singleton

customer_reviews.title: Great keyboard... until it stops working!
customer_reviews.text: Originally this keyboard was amazing! The brown switches are comfortable to type on all day. Unfortunately, the “1” key and the “~” stopped working a few days ago out of thin air! I work from home and I realized just how much I relied on that number 1 key :(. Had it not been for those keys going out I would have said this was a spectacular keyboard for the price!
customer_reviews.author: Luis Medina

customer_reviews.title: Lasted about 6 months.
customer_reviews.text: I've had the keyboard for around 6 months. I use it extensively for both writing and gaming. For the last week the W key has slowly gotten less responsive. I'd thought it was my own computer for a while, and only thought it might be the keyboard the last few days. I clean it regularly and there isn't any visible damage. The same issue persists across multiple computers with the keyboard. I can only imagine the switch is dying. Sadly, the W key ends up being my most used key and it needs to be dependable for gaming, so I would consider the keyboard broken.
customer_reviews.author: Abby

customer_reviews.title: Great keyboard!
customer_reviews.text: This is my first mechanical keyboard. I have only used regular keyboards before this. I bought two one for myself and one for my mom (she is a very fast typist and had issues with regular keyboards). This keyboard is awesome. I like the smooth typing and it isn't too loud for my office work. I do also play some games with it and I have had no complaints so far. My mom said" It's fast it's easy, it makes typing so you don't have to think your fingers just fly. My accuracy has gone back up with this keyboard."
customer_reviews.author: Daniel

customer_reviews.title: Very nice touch to the keyboard
customer_reviews.text: A hair soft for my taste. This was just for an "at home" keyboard, and I've been very happy with it. Backlit, not RGB, but I was only looking for something so I knew where the keyboard was (I'm a touch typist). Having to use it while working from home, I now find it's a little softer to the touch than my keyboard I use at work. Still a great keyboard for the price and the general use.
customer_reviews.author: Steven L. Krantz

customer_reviews.title: It's Like Typing on Silk
customer_reviews.text: My fingers were very happy this morning when I first set this up at my office desk. For reference I am switching form black switches to brown, which I think at this point (less than 24 hours in) should be the first choice if you're looking for an office keyboard. It's quiet, feels like haptic butter on the phalanges, and isn't that obnoxious in an office setting (part of my my decision of this purchase was based on the fact that this keyboard doesn't like a dying rave, it's subtle simplicity are much appreciated). Also, I bought this with the money I made from working said office jobs, I'm throwing that out there for credibility. Keep typing y'all. Thanks,
customer_reviews.author: Arzay

customer_reviews.title: Keys don't feel great, lighting effects are excessive, and the keys are falling out
customer_reviews.text: After only 2 months, the delete key will not stay in, regardless of how and how many times I put it back. The design is okay, and the keyboard has some weight to it, but the lighting effects are too much for my tastes. I'd like a keyboard to stay together for at least a year after I get it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good... when it works.
customer_reviews.text: Certain keys have stopped activating every time they are pressed. Click. Nothing. Click. Nothing. Mash. Suddenly works. I suppose the moral of this story is "don't buy products made by the world's biggest communist slave labour camp". If only Chinese products were clearly labeled.
customer_reviews.author: Whisper

customer_reviews.title: Ok for the price
customer_reviews.text: It is a nice keyboard, has some good weight to it and feels sturdy. It's cheaper than the competitors because it doesn't use CherryMX switches. They are still the brown switches, but they are considerably louder than the CherryMXBrown's on my Logitech. If you are buying for home, it will work great as a basic keyboard to introduce you to the wonders of a mechanical keyboard, however, if you purchase for your office/cube (as I did), it might annoy some of your co-workers.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Evans

customer_reviews.title: Very Good Mechnical Keyboard (Brown Key Type)
customer_reviews.text: I really like this keyboard (typing on it now). It isn't too loud but still has the definite tactical feedback. I took it apart (reasons below) and it appears to be well-built. I did make one modification. The indicators on the right top, the Num Lock, was too bright and cannot be dimmed by the key LED lighting control. I took the keyboard apart and put two strips of thin clear-yellow Mylar tape across the LED. Now it is perfect, just a medium lighted green light to indicate Num Lock.
customer_reviews.author: Richard

customer_reviews.title: Freelance Writer Approved
customer_reviews.text: Great value for the price. The keyboard feels great and, while it does have the nice "clicky" sound, it's not loud or obnoxious. The only issue I had when moving from a smaller membrane keyboard is the height. This keyboard is about twice as thick as my last one, which meant I had to bend my wrists uncomfortably to type. But a nice memory foam wrist rest solved that problem. The LEDs are also very subtle. Bright enough to see in a well-lit room, but not so dark as to be distracting in a dark room. If you want a mechanical keyboard without paying the "Hardcore Gitgud MLGProGamer 360 NoSkope XXXXTREEEM!!!11" surcharge, this is the one for you.
customer_reviews.author: Darryl Mott Jr.

customer_reviews.title: Lousy Keyboard NOT Recommended for GAMING
customer_reviews.text: No height adjustment, no USB ports, sad. I like to add I only used this keyboard for a few months now and one of the key plastic insert underneath broke off. I don't recommend this! Update: Worst keyboard for gaming! Plastic key tabs on the underneath of the key breaks off. I had 4 that broke off! So I took it and threw it into trash. Also the POOR printing on the keys at times you hardly can make it out, such as the dollar sign and some of the other symbols. NOT RECOMMENDED.
customer_reviews.author: Vulcan Nomad

customer_reviews.title: I don't know that I can go back
customer_reviews.text: I've had the wireless keyboard now for about a week & I don't know that I can go back to a membrane keyboard after this. I'm a sucker for tactile feedback & this keyboard delivers that experience perfectly. I use the keyboard in an office environment & i'm not any louder than any of my colleagues mashing on their membrane keyboards. The keyboard build quality feels excellent & it has a nice heftiness about it. It feels like a well-thought out & executed product. I would definitely purchase it again.
customer_reviews.author: Andy

customer_reviews.title: Needs low battery warning
customer_reviews.text: This keyboard is ok but it lacks a low battery warning. Now it seems they are only offering a wired version. Apparently it was easier to add a cord than it was to add a low battery light. Other than that, the keyboard is fine, aside from the part where it always dies while I'm in the middle of typing something.
customer_reviews.author: Rachara

customer_reviews.title: Good but cheap
customer_reviews.text: It feels cheap and I don't like the weighting of the keys - it's not subastantial enough for my tastes, especially given the obnoxious clacking that comes with it. Some mechanical keyboards are worth the noise, but this one isn't, at least for me. However, I appreciate the backlighting, and there's really nothing wrong at all with the keyboard, which works very well and is in most aspects a normal, slightly above average keyboard. It's just not to my personal taste.
customer_reviews.author: Hope

customer_reviews.title: This full size board has the same great key press action
customer_reviews.text: I bought this board after having purchased the tenkeyless version, which I give 5 stars. This full size board has the same great key press action. I took off a star because... 1. There are no feet to pop out and raise the back of the keyboard -- and it needs to be raised. 2. The LED lights aren't nearly as bright as the tenkeyless version. They are barely visible in the highest setting. Otherwise, this is a good board for the price.
customer_reviews.author: WW4

customer_reviews.title: starsWorks fine; nicer than chicklet for extended typing
customer_reviews.text: Works fine. Lots of dumb light blinking patterns--for a moment, I was worried that there was no option to turn the lights off, then I noticed that you can just decrease the brightness to zero. The clear letters on the keys aren't as nice looking as on my maxkeyboard nighthawk, with some letters like O divided into two segments as for a spray paint stencil. But at least they're not trying to look like Klingon runes like some of the other cheap mechanical keyboards on this website. Overall, it met my expectations and will serve fine as a second work keyboard for our remote office.
customer_reviews.author: Edgar Swooth

customer_reviews.title: Not Just for Gaming!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this keyboard for my dad to use for casual purposes (he was really impressed by my own Velocifire keyboard, which is the smaller version of this one I believe). He loves it! Like any mechanical keyboard I've tried, it has a tactile feel and resistance that makes using it a pleasure. Before either one of us had one of these, we thought keyboards were keyboards; we were wrong.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not the same as Mac version
customer_reviews.text: Be aware: I bought this PC keyboard after trying my son's Mac version. It is not as nice as the Mac version. The keys are not the same brown touch, they are softer and quieter. The backlight is blue while the Mac's white looks better in my opinion. The usb cord is plain vinyl while the Mac's is a nice fabric cover. It did cost less so I guess it was to be expected. I just don't get why they wouldn't sell the exact same keyboard but with PC specific keys. I still give it 4 stars because it is a nice keyboard
customer_reviews.author: Daniel C Chertiza

customer_reviews.title: Decent when new, won't last
customer_reviews.text: I own 3 of these keyboards now. Well, 2 working and one not working. On the plus side, it's a great keyboard when new. Excellent key feel and decent features for the price. I haven't had any of the individual key problems other reviewers have had. Mine just entirely stopped working after 14 months. In other situations I'd give this kind of experience 2 or 3 stars. But you'll notice they've replied to just about every 1 or 2 star review, asking them to email in, maybe they can help the client's problem. I did that, over a week ago, and they never replied. I wouldn't say entirely avoid, but definitely spend that extra $1.40 for the square trade warranty.
customer_reviews.author: Steve W.

customer_reviews.title: A good keyboard for a good price
customer_reviews.text: I readily admit that I'm not even remotely an expert on mechanical keyboards, and the various red/blue/brown/whatever switches. All I really know is that I like solid keyboards with keys that aren't squishy, and I don't like to spend too much. This keyboard is an excellent balance between those two points. If you're someone who actually knows the difference between the various color switches, you probably will want something better. If you want to replace that cheap crappy keyboard that came with your PC without breaking the bank, though, this is a great choice.
customer_reviews.author: J. Glass

customer_reviews.title: Unreliable
customer_reviews.text: This product is so close to being great. It has so many of the features I want at a great price. The thing holding it back is what even the cheapest keyboards get right: actually sending a keystroke when you hit a key, and not sending one when you don't hit a key. I work as a programmer and it's infuriating when this keyboard malfunctions, which is often. I am probably going to get a new keyboard and use this one as a media pc keyboard.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Jacob Behnke

customer_reviews.title: Nice little keyboard
customer_reviews.text: I'm not a keyboard aficionado by any means but since my kids destroyed my first two more expensive mechanical keyboards I decided to bite on this one since it was not as expensive as the other two Corsairs I had. Haven't used to it to long but taking it out of the package it has a weighty, high quality feel and rubber pads/grips on the bottom. Has a nice LED effect. I think they said Green but it feels like an aqua/sea color. Keys seem a bit spongy, but it could be me just getting used to it. Overall, a nice little keyboard for a good price.
customer_reviews.author: DJA0216

customer_reviews.title: Scratchy switches, but build and size make up for it for the price.
customer_reviews.text: Very sturdy feeling as well as pretty heavy. Switches are outemu brown switches and are okay, but fairly scratchy feeling. Pros: Heavy Doubleshot ABS keycaps with good font Full sized Pleasant backlight color Pretty clean looking overall Metal back plate Cons: Switches are very scratchy, worse than cherry reds (still better than a membrane) Plastics aren't the best Fairly large with the bezels around the sides Only one static typing position There may be quite some boons with the keyboard, but for the price, you'll be hard pressed to find a better full sized mechanical keyboard.
customer_reviews.author: Goat

customer_reviews.title: Great for the price
customer_reviews.text: Not bad. I needed a new keyboard for work and didn't want to spend too much money. Currently using a Corsair K70 with Cherry MX brown switches. The Cherry is definitely better. Feels a little sharper and a bit more premium. The Velocifire feels a little more hollow and squishy. Still a massive upgrade from a standard rubber dome type keyboard. The keyboard has a nice sturdy base and has some good weight to it. Shouldn't slip and slide on your table.
customer_reviews.author: Seb

customer_reviews.title: Good Professional Mechanical Keyboard.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for work and it is much better than the default HP keyboard that came with my desktop. Although the LED's only light up a light blue/cyan color, there are some programmable settings for the lighting pattern. It is no where near as comprehensive as Razer's Black Widow, but at a fraction of the price (and since it is for a work environment), I don't mind. Note that it does not have any stands underneath to raise the height, so if you need that you'll have to use a book or something. The keyboard itself is heavy and the pads on the bottom do a good job keeping it from sliding.
customer_reviews.author: Rock in the Socks

customer_reviews.title: Feels much better then the standard dell keyboard i was using
customer_reviews.text: Just recently got this keyboard. So far i have had no issues with it and it does everything i need it to do. I mainly play mmos and it feels alot easier to use my skills. Feels much better then the standard dell keyboard i was using. For the price you cant go wrong. It is a good entry mechanical keyboard. However if you have a little more to spend, i would say go for the G710+ by logitech. That is what i am planning to buy here soon and give this keyboard to a friend who is currently using a stock dell keyboard. Update May 1 2017. No issues so far still working great!!! Love this keyboard!!
customer_reviews.author: Anna

customer_reviews.title: A pretty strong typist as I've been programming for over 35 ...
customer_reviews.text: I am a big fan of mechanical keyboards. Normally in the past I've gone with Blue switches but I was wanting something a little bit softer and quieter this time so I went with brown. This keyboard has more than exceeded my expectations. I definitely have not seen any ghosting in the Keys. A pretty strong typist as I've been programming for over 35 years comma and the placement and feel of the keys is phenomenal. The backlight is pleasant but not overwhelming. I really didn't buy it for all of the advanced lighting effects so I can't comment on those as much though it does have a good assortment of effects available.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas W. Knox

customer_reviews.title: Nice keyboard
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my wife. We're casual gamers but use the computer for a lot more than that so we got the brown switches. Definitely a lot better than the keyboards we've been used to, took a day or 2 to get used to but then it was awesome. Update: The mechanical switches are great. Never going back to the old style again. 3 months in and her WASD are still looking brand new. I just got rid of my old membrane and bought another one of these for myself. Even though it's the same keyboard my wife remarked- hers doesn't have keyboard risers- odd that.
customer_reviews.author: Dan in Washington

customer_reviews.title: Great mechanical keyboard for office
customer_reviews.text: I type on this keyboard every day. It is just loud enough that my officemates are intrigued by it, but not loud enough that anyone is annoyed. I do get some double keying on occasion, but I think part of that has to do with the fact that I am used to typing on terrible membrane keyboards and slam my fingers while I am typing inconsistently, triggering the actuation more than once in a keystroke. Other than that, the keyboard is nice and heavy, the backlight is awesome, and the keys feel great, if not a bit "hollow" sounding on actuation. For the price though, you can't go wrong!
customer_reviews.author: Justin

customer_reviews.title: Overall a very good keyboard
customer_reviews.text: This keyboard feels exactly like a DAS MX Brown keyboard which cost three times more. I've had it for 2 weeks. What I like the most is this keyboard has a great bouncy tactile feedback, my fingers do not get sore after long hours of typing. The travel length of the keys are just about right. I'm also happy with the solid construction of this keyboard. If you are considering purchasing this keyboard, you should probably buy a wrist rest as well, so you won't have any problem with the height, which does seem a bit more elevated than other keyboards I've had in the past.
customer_reviews.author: S T

customer_reviews.title: Great Quality for Value!
customer_reviews.text: I wasn't sure what to expect when ordering this keyboard, but I am pleasantly surprised! As others have mentioned, a good deal of heft, which makes this feel a bit more "high quality," but overall I don't have any complaints! I could nitpick that the backlight leaves a bit to be desired, but for the price, you have to expect a few areas that might be lacking...though there aren't many! For $60 I got a backlit mechanical keyboard that charges via usb-c, brown switches, and a respectable battery! I'm more than happy to recommend this to anybody who wants a better feeling keyboard for the office without breaking the bank.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan F.

customer_reviews.title: Non-working keys right out of the box
customer_reviews.text: I immediately returned this one. It had at least the backspace, enter, and shift keys not working right out of the box. I really like my TKL01 wired velocifire, and decided to add the comparable 104-key velocifire VM01 model, but I guess I got a defective one. I suppose I'll just obtain a keypad instead.
customer_reviews.author: K. Buckner

customer_reviews.title: without question the fastest keyboard this old-timer ever used
customer_reviews.text: I have been keyboarding on computers since 1980. I have seen a few good ones. My hands are accustomed to the more ancient keyboards. But this keyboard provides me with better response and effortless high-speed keyboarding like I have never seen in all of these 40 years. I don't know what gamers use. Never done it. But my thoughts go to the computer with less effort than I have ever seen. Not very technical review, I suppose, but I love this keyboard!!!
customer_reviews.author: Wes E Johnson

customer_reviews.title: It's a really nice mechanical keyboard for the price
customer_reviews.text: It's a really nice mechanical keyboard for the price. I've been using a low profile gaming keyboard for 4-5 years, though, and didn't see much of an improvement in key travel and response time with this keyboard. I also thought the keys were a little too light to actuate for my taste. I might be one of those people that needs to shell out for Cherry MX Clears, which I'm clearly not prepared to do at the price this Velocifire is going for.
customer_reviews.author: Alucard212

customer_reviews.title: After 1 day. I'm kinda impressed.
customer_reviews.text: While I've only had this keyboard for 1 day I feel like it's a quality keyboard. The brown switches are pleasant change from the cherry mx reds I'm used too. The backlighting is nice but a little dim. Maybe changing the caps to more translucent ones would be better. The battery came charged and I haven't had to plug it in yet. Although it's only been used for maybe an hour total. For wireless mechanical keyboard under 100 bucks. I think this thing is a steal.
customer_reviews.author: Tyler

customer_reviews.title: best deal on an MX brown clone keyboard, hands down
customer_reviews.text: My husband got this keyboard recently since it is currently the best deal on a MX brown clone keyboard, he is extremely satisfied with it. The LEDs are a blue-green color which is a nice contrast to the solid red / blue / green single-color LED types currently available. Pros: MX Brown switch is much quieter than Blue clicky-types, full size keyboard w/ backlight for under $40 (amazing in itself), function keys for multimedia and LED settings, typing is very fast and responsive, very good quality and solid feel overall Cons: Lacks angle adjustment
customer_reviews.author: lia173

customer_reviews.title: They keys are slippery
customer_reviews.text: If you are gamer this may not matter to you, but if you use the keyboard to write, then forget about it. They stoke is not crisp enough for me. I know some like this mushy feel but i don't. And the keys are kinda slippery, every time my finger tips make contact with the key it feels like it's slipping. It's kinda hard to describe but anyways, if you need a keyboard to write then this is not it.
customer_reviews.author: E. KANG

customer_reviews.title: Perfect entry-level mechanical keyboard.
customer_reviews.text: So far so good! Cherry Brown switches as advertised, a handful of lighting animations (with two brightness levels and a speed control), decent build quality, and enough heft to prevent rattling. Could be improved with some flip-up height adjusters, but I won't complain too loudly considering the price.
customer_reviews.author: Maxaxle

customer_reviews.title: Great keyboard; the "Get a FREE $1.99 Amazon Gift Card From Velocifire Easily!" survey email is SLOW though.
customer_reviews.text: This mechanical keyboard is amazing for $35, solid quality, nice quiet keystrokes. Lack of a wrist-rest is a bummer, as is being unable to tilt the keyboard with any built in legs or anything, so you WILL need a 3rd party wrist rest. Edit: However, be aware that the "Get a FREE $1.99 Amazon Gift Card From Velocifire Easily!" survey that they will email you takes 10+ days to process, apparently. At least, I waited that long, then left this review complaining about it before they sent the gift card, so maybe it's just a long processing time.
customer_reviews.author: Jim P

customer_reviews.title: First 3 months 2nd 6 Months
customer_reviews.text: Figured first one was a fluke fail and tried again. Took it apart for spare parts intending to order another. 2nd unit, left side of keyboard, random fails and lost use of left side tab and control keys. Cordless but have to leave on charge so not really cordless. Giving up and trying something else.
customer_reviews.author: Bill Pilcher

customer_reviews.title: Impressive quality
customer_reviews.text: I was not expecting such a nice keyboard. the keys have a very nice feel. not too loud of a keyboard but there is some noise because I type pretty hard. different light modes are pretty cool. this is much better than my previous Das which stopped working randomly one day. I would recommend and buy again.
customer_reviews.author: BB

customer_reviews.title: Excellent value and offers a solid typing experience.
customer_reviews.text: Banging on this right now - use it for work where I write A LOT (IT). Does everything you want a mech. keyboard to do and more. It's been months now and nothing has changed, holding up very well, no real wear to speak of. Double shot keys mean it should be a very long time before anything goes wrong with them. They keys do a have a bit of hollow clickyness to them, the space bar was slanted just too much for me but was resolved by using my KB tray at work instead of the desk. All in all a quality board you can rely on. Good back-lighting, too.
customer_reviews.author: Ionlybuydeals

customer_reviews.title: Excellent keyboard for the price.
customer_reviews.text: I got this keyboard yesterday (which I paid for myself) and I'm already in love. This is my first mechanical keyboard since very early childhood, and I'd forgotten how pleasant the sensation is. This thing is a nice size, not too big or gaudy looking, but it's hefty. The backlighting is a lovely teal color, which you can change the brightness and pattern (flashing, wave, or solid light). I bought this for gaming because my previous keyboard was not only ghosting, but it was wireless and battery powered. I can't compare this to similar keyboards, but for me it works perfectly and I love it.
customer_reviews.author: Ashley

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't work in BIOS
customer_reviews.text: It's a pretty good board, especially for ~$30. Everything looks and works fine, with one very notable exception: it won't work in BIOS/startup. Kind of defeats the purpose of buying a new keyboard when you have to keep a spare to fix your computer if something happens.
customer_reviews.author: Al

customer_reviews.title: 250+ hours is a false claim or my keyboard is defective
customer_reviews.text: I love this keyboard but it is a shame that the battery is not lasting more than 24 hours. That is without using backlight. I contacted the amazon tech support and the person kept asking me what batteries I am using. I had to explain that this keyboard has a built in battery and that's why I am calling.
customer_reviews.author: Mr.Khan

customer_reviews.title: excellent value, less than perfect
customer_reviews.text: Should not have waited so long to get a back-lit keyboard. By chance, this fit every one of my preferences: quiet (but not silent) keys, adjustable back-lighting, heavy, full-sized. This has enabled me to use my computer in low light conditions, like at night when I can't sleep, and the only light is from my screen. What knocked this down to four stars is the less-than-clear etching of some of the numeric keys that make the symbols (used by pressing the SHIFT key) somewhat difficult to read, even with the back-lighting.
customer_reviews.author: JB L.

customer_reviews.title: Great Economical Mechanical Keyboard
customer_reviews.text: For $40, you really can't go wrong with this keyboard. I have another mechanical keyboard with Cherry MX Brown switches, and this one feels very comparable. I use this in an office setting, so I did add o-rings to the keycaps. It decreases the sound a bit, but still sounds and feels great. The adjustable lighting is a plus and easily changed to different modes or can be turned off completely. Overall, excellent keyboard for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Tucker

customer_reviews.title: Loud
customer_reviews.text: I bought this keyboard for my husband as a gaming keyboard to try and eliminate some of the wires in our office space. He loves it, the lights turn off after you stop typing for a while, the keyboard itself is thick and heavy with nice and sturdy buttons... That being said, this thing is LOUD. Louder than most keyboards I've ever used. He didn't want a hushed keyboard that's why I picked this one but this kind of sounds like we are using a typewriter! Battery life lasts about one day. needs to be charged every night if you plan on using it daily.
customer_reviews.author: Rachel Dominguez

customer_reviews.title: Great Purchase
customer_reviews.text: I was cautious about buying a mechanical keyboard, after using a laptop. But, did my homework and this one is great. My only complaint, it will not pair with Windows 10. I have to leave the USB plugged in. Otherwise, it works great and has really cut down on the errors when typing, plus can type more wpm. Don't let the paring stop your decision. I would buy it again in a minute.
customer_reviews.author: emcnett

customer_reviews.title: Excellent for its price
customer_reviews.text: For the price point, this is a well made keyboard which is well-suited to office work and programming where you might not want a loud, clicky keyboard which would disturb your office mates. The keyboard feels nice and heft, and is built quite solidly in general, although it does lack a wrist rest. The keycaps feel great, better than some higher-priced mechanicals I've used. The switches themselves are clearly MX brown-like off-brands, with a little less tactile feedback, but still very workable and, again, a sight cheaper than some. Customer service was also good, and consistently got back to me in a timely manner when I had a small problem.
customer_reviews.author: James Mumma Boggs

customer_reviews.title: Squeaky, creaky junk.
customer_reviews.text: This just arrived, I opened it up to press a few keys, and I won't even be plugging it in. Keys across the board are squeaking like an old mattress. There's even a gritty, plasticy friction you can feel in the movement of the switches. Stay away from these terrible knock-offs of Cherry brown switches. I don't understand how there are so many good reviews.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: keyboard is nice and seems well built
customer_reviews.text: Out of the box, keyboard is nice and seems well built. However, after about 6 months of gaming on it, my right arrow key cap has broken off, and my shift keys do not work with 100% reliability. i <---- sometimes have to hit the shift key multiple times before it will actually engage the shift mechanism. Other key caps like the Y key and the G key are loose and will fall off if i hold the keyboard upside down. Somewhat disappointing, though I can't complain too much as the price was pretty nice.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Parker

customer_reviews.title: key broke and fell off...
customer_reviews.text: I've had this keyboard for less than a year, and one of the keys just fell off! I cannot put it back on because the little plastic piece that attaches it to the keyboard has broken. Several of the other keys have come loose and fallen off, but this was the first time a key actually broke. I guess this company's keyboards do not have great durability? Pretty annoying.. And they would not give me a replacement because it's been a few months since the warranty expired. The keys are also much louder than I'd like them to be, but that pales in comparison to this new issue. Buyer beware. This is the last Velocifire keyboard I'll ever buy...
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: so overall this is good dollar for dollar
customer_reviews.text: I got this to mimic a cherry mx brown that a coworker has. I am new to mechanical keyboards, or at least haven't used them since they were used in the 80's and early 90s. I have gone back to back between this and the corsair cherry MX brown keyboard, and they are fairly comparable, but there is a "spring rebound" noise on this one that I don't hear at all with the Cherry MX keyboard. I would give a slight edge to that keyboard, but it is twice the price, so overall this is good dollar for dollar, but not quite on par in terms of key feel/noise.
customer_reviews.author: Jeffrey A. Evey

product_meta.title: Velocifire VM01 Mechanical Keyboard 104-Key Full Size with Brown Switches LED Illuminated Backlit Anti-ghosting Keys for Copywriter, Gamer and Programmer
feature_bullets: MUST HAVE- Velocifire mechanical keyboard is designed for copywriter, programmer, editors who spend many hours typing every day. You will get better at typing speed and accuracy through Velocifire mechanical keyboards.

Durable Brown Switch- Low-noise switches have a tactile bump for feedback with every key-press. It is much QUIETER than Blue Switch but LOUDER than a regular Membrane keyboard. If you never used a mechanical keyboard before, please think about whether you can accept its sound first.

Full 104-key Double - Shot ABS keycap - Double-shot molding is a process of molding plastic around a preformed metal or plastic insert, which is a very popular technique to produce durable keycaps. Velocifire mechanical keyboard with full 104-key double-shot ABS keycap which is impact resistant, lightweight and very durable.

ANTI-GHOSTING - This is sometime used in place of Key Rollover, but the terminology is incorrect since ghosting is a different (and rare) issue. You will need to do more research to see what key rollover technology is being used. Ghosting is when two or more keys are pressed and a key that was not pressed registers instead.
Money Back -- Velocifire offers a 30 days money back. We always serve you after the sale!

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.0 out of 5 stars1,169 ratings4.0 out of 5 stars
